values.name: None
values.description: The caching mode for the disk is not enabled.

values.name: ReadOnly
values.description: The caching mode for the disk is read only.

values.name: ReadWrite
values.description: The caching mode for the disk is read and write.

values.name: StandardLRS
values.description: The data disk should use standard locally redundant storage.

values.name: PremiumLRS
values.description: The data disk should use premium locally redundant storage.

values.name: StandardSSDLRS
values.description: The data disk / OS disk should use standard SSD locally redundant storage.

values.name: DockerCompatible
values.description: A Docker compatible container technology will be used to launch the containers.

values.name: CriCompatible
values.description: A CRI based technology will be used to launch the containers.

values.name: OsDisk
values.description: The OS Disk on the compute node is encrypted.

values.name: TemporaryDisk
values.description: The temporary disk on the compute node is encrypted. On Linux this encryption applies to other partitions (such as those on mounted data disks) when encryption occurs at boot time.

values.name: Regional
values.description: All nodes in the pool will be allocated in the same region.

values.name: Zonal
values.description: Nodes in the pool will be spread across different availability zones with best effort balancing.

values.name: CacheDisk
values.description: The Ephemeral OS Disk is stored on the VM cache.

Enums.name: SecurityTypes

values.name: trustedLaunch
values.description: Trusted launch protects against advanced and persistent attack techniques.

Enums.description: Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine. It has to be set to any specified value to enable UefiSettings.

values.name: None
values.description: No dynamic VNet assignment is enabled.

values.name: Job
values.description: Dynamic VNet assignment is done per-job.

values.name: Tcp
values.description: Use TCP for the endpoint.

values.name: Udp
values.description: Use UDP for the endpoint.

values.name: Allow
values.description: Allow access.

values.name: Deny
values.description: Deny access.

values.name: BatchManaged
values.description: A public IP will be created and managed by Batch. There may be multiple public IPs depending on the size of the Pool.

values.name: UserManaged
values.description: Public IPs are provided by the user and will be used to provision the Compute Nodes.

values.name: NoPublicIpAddresses
values.description: No public IP Address will be created.

values.name: TaskWorkingDirectory
values.description: Use the standard Batch service Task working directory, which will contain the Task Resource Files populated by Batch.

values.name: ContainerImageDefault
values.description: Use the working directory defined in the container Image. Beware that this directory will not contain the Resource Files downloaded by Batch.

values.name: Task
values.description: Specifies that the service should create a new user for the Task.

values.name: Pool
values.description: Specifies that the Task runs as the common auto user Account which is created on every Compute Node in a Pool.

values.name: NonAdmin
values.description: The user is a standard user without elevated access.

values.name: Admin
values.description: The user is a user with elevated access and operates with full Administrator permissions.

values.name: Spread
values.description: Tasks should be assigned evenly across all Compute Nodes in the Pool.

values.name: Pack
values.description: As many Tasks as possible (taskSlotsPerNode) should be assigned to each Compute Node in the Pool before any Tasks are assigned to the next Compute Node in the Pool.

values.name: Batch
values.description: The LOGON32_LOGON_BATCH Win32 login mode. The batch login mode is recommended for long running parallel processes.

values.name: Interactive
values.description: The LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE Win32 login mode. UAC is enabled on Windows VirtualMachineConfiguration Pools. If this option is used with an elevated user identity in a Windows VirtualMachineConfiguration Pool, the user session will not be elevated unless the application executed by the Task command line is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege.

values.name: Default
values.description: The node communication mode is automatically set by the Batch service.

values.name: Classic
values.description: Nodes using the classic communication mode require inbound TCP communication on ports 29876 and 29877 from the "BatchNodeManagement.{region}" service tag and outbound TCP communication on port 443 to the "Storage.region" and "BatchNodeManagement.{region}" service tags.

values.name: Simplified
values.description: Nodes using the simplified communication mode require outbound TCP communication on port 443 to the "BatchNodeManagement.{region}" service tag. No open inbound ports are required.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: TAll virtual machines in the scale set are automatically updated at the same time.

values.name: Manual
values.description: You control the application of updates to virtual machines in the scale set. You do this by using the manualUpgrade action.

values.name: Rolling
values.description: The existing instances in a scale set are brought down in batches to be upgraded. Once the upgraded batch is complete, the instances will begin taking traffic again and the next batch will begin. This continues until all instances brought up-to-date.

values.name: Active
values.description: The Pool is available to run Tasks subject to the availability of Compute Nodes.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: The user has requested that the Pool be deleted, but the delete operation has not yet completed.

values.name: Steady
values.description: The Pool is not resizing. There are no changes to the number of Compute Nodes in the Pool in progress. A Pool enters this state when it is created and when no operations are being performed on the Pool to change the number of Compute Nodes.

values.name: Resizing
values.description: The Pool is resizing; that is, Compute Nodes are being added to or removed from the Pool.

values.name: Stopping
values.description: The Pool was resizing, but the user has requested that the resize be stopped, but the stop request has not yet been completed.

values.name: UserAssigned
values.description: Batch pool has user assigned identities with it.

values.name: None
values.description: Batch pool has no identity associated with it. Setting `None` in update pool will remove existing identities.

values.name: Requeue
values.description: Terminate running Task processes and requeue the Tasks. The Tasks will run again when a Compute Node is available. Remove Compute Nodes as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: Terminate
values.description: Terminate running Tasks. The Tasks will be completed with failureInfo indicating that they were terminated, and will not run again. Remove Compute Nodes as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: TaskCompletion
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete. Schedule no new Tasks while waiting. Remove Compute Nodes when all Tasks have completed.

values.name: RetainedData
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete, then wait for all Task data retention periods to expire. Schedule no new Tasks while waiting. Remove Compute Nodes when all Task retention periods have expired.

values.name: Linux
values.description: The Linux operating system.

values.name: Windows
values.description: The Windows operating system.

values.name: Verified
values.description: The Image is guaranteed to be compatible with the associated Compute Node agent SKU and all Batch features have been confirmed to work as expected.

values.name: Unverified
values.description: The associated Compute Node agent SKU should have binary compatibility with the Image, but specific functionality has not been verified.

values.name: Active
values.description: The Job is available to have Tasks scheduled.

values.name: Disabling
values.description: A user has requested that the Job be disabled, but the disable operation is still in progress (for example, waiting for Tasks to terminate).

values.name: Disabled
values.description: A user has disabled the Job. No Tasks are running, and no new Tasks will be scheduled.

values.name: Enabling
values.description: A user has requested that the Job be enabled, but the enable operation is still in progress.

values.name: Terminating
values.description: The Job is about to complete, either because a Job Manager Task has completed or because the user has terminated the Job, but the terminate operation is still in progress (for example, because Job Release Tasks are running).

values.name: Completed
values.description: All Tasks have terminated, and the system will not accept any more Tasks or any further changes to the Job.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: A user has requested that the Job be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress (for example, because the system is still terminating running Tasks).

values.name: TaskSuccess
values.description: Upload the file(s) only after the Task process exits with an exit code of 0.

values.name: TaskFailure
values.description: Upload the file(s) only after the Task process exits with a nonzero exit code.

values.name: TaskCompletion
values.description: Upload the file(s) after the Task process exits, no matter what the exit code was.

values.name: Job
values.description: Grants access to perform all operations on the Job containing the Task.

values.name: JobSchedule
values.description: The Pool exists for the lifetime of the Job Schedule. The Batch Service creates the Pool when it creates the first Job on the schedule. You may apply this option only to Job Schedules, not to Jobs.

values.name: Job
values.description: The Pool exists for the lifetime of the Job to which it is dedicated. The Batch service creates the Pool when it creates the Job. If the 'job' option is applied to a Job Schedule, the Batch service creates a new auto Pool for every Job created on the schedule.

Enums.name: OnAllBatchTasksComplete

values.name: NoAction
values.description: Do nothing. The Job remains active unless terminated or disabled by some other means.

values.name: TerminateJob
values.description: Terminate the Job. The Job's terminationReason is set to 'AllTasksComplete'.

Enums.description: The action the Batch service should take when all Tasks in the Job are in the completed state.

values.name: NoAction
values.description: Do nothing. The Job remains active unless terminated or disabled by some other means.

values.name: PerformExitOptionsJobAction
values.description: Terminate the Job. The Job's terminationReason is set to 'AllTasksComplete'.

values.name: UserError
values.description: The error is due to a user issue, such as misconfiguration.

values.name: ServerError
values.description: The error is due to an internal server issue.

values.name: Requeue
values.description: Terminate running Tasks and requeue them. The Tasks will run again when the Job is enabled.

values.name: Terminate
values.description: Terminate running Tasks. The Tasks will be completed with failureInfo indicating that they were terminated, and will not run again.

values.name: Wait
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete.

values.name: Running
values.description: The Task is currently running (including retrying).

values.name: Completed
values.description: The Task has exited with exit code 0, or the Task has exhausted its retry limit, or the Batch service was unable to start the Task due to Task preparation errors (such as resource file download failures).

values.name: Success
values.description: The Task ran successfully.

values.name: Failure
values.description: There was an error during processing of the Task. The failure may have occurred before the Task process was launched, while the Task process was executing, or after the Task process exited.

values.name: Running
values.description: The Task is currently running (including retrying).

values.name: Completed
values.description: The Task has exited with exit code 0, or the Task has exhausted its retry limit, or the Batch service was unable to start the Task due to Task preparation errors (such as resource file download failures).

values.name: Active
values.description: The Job Schedule is active and will create Jobs as per its schedule.

values.name: Completed
values.description: The Job Schedule has terminated, either by reaching its end time or by the user terminating it explicitly.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: The user has disabled the Job Schedule. The scheduler will not initiate any new Jobs will on this schedule, but any existing active Job will continue to run.

values.name: Terminating
values.description: The Job Schedule has no more work to do, or has been explicitly terminated by the user, but the termination operation is still in progress. The scheduler will not initiate any new Jobs for this Job Schedule, nor is any existing Job active.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: The user has requested that the Job Schedule be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress. The scheduler will not initiate any new Jobs for this Job Schedule, and will delete any existing Jobs and Tasks under the Job Schedule, including any active Job. The Job Schedule will be deleted when all Jobs and Tasks under the Job Schedule have been deleted.

values.name: None
values.description: Take no action.

values.name: Disable
values.description: Disable the Job. This is equivalent to calling the disable Job API, with a disableTasks value of requeue.

values.name: Terminate
values.description: Terminate the Job. The terminationReason in the Job's executionInfo is set to "TaskFailed".

values.name: Satisfy
values.description: Satisfy tasks waiting on this task; once all dependencies are satisfied, the task will be scheduled to run.

values.name: Block
values.description: Blocks tasks waiting on this task, preventing them from being scheduled.

values.name: Active
values.description: The Task is queued and able to run, but is not currently assigned to a Compute Node. A Task enters this state when it is created, when it is enabled after being disabled, or when it is awaiting a retry after a failed run.

values.name: Preparing
values.description: The Task has been assigned to a Compute Node, but is waiting for a required Job Preparation Task to complete on the Compute Node. If the Job Preparation Task succeeds, the Task will move to running. If the Job Preparation Task fails, the Task will return to active and will be eligible to be assigned to a different Compute Node.

values.name: Running
values.description: The Task is running on a Compute Node. This includes task-level preparation such as downloading resource files or deploying Packages specified on the Task - it does not necessarily mean that the Task command line has started executing.

values.name: Completed
values.description: The Task is no longer eligible to run, usually because the Task has finished successfully, or the Task has finished unsuccessfully and has exhausted its retry limit. A Task is also marked as completed if an error occurred launching the Task, or when the Task has been terminated.

values.name: Success
values.description: The Task was added successfully.

values.name: ClientError
values.description: The Task failed to add due to a client error and should not be retried without modifying the request as appropriate.

values.name: ServerError
values.description: Task failed to add due to a server error and can be retried without modification.

values.name: Preparing
values.description: The Task has been assigned to a Compute Node, but is waiting for a required Job Preparation Task to complete on the Compute Node. If the Job Preparation Task succeeds, the Task will move to running. If the Job Preparation Task fails, the Task will return to active and will be eligible to be assigned to a different Compute Node.

values.name: Running
values.description: The Task is running on a Compute Node. This includes task-level preparation such as downloading resource files or deploying Packages specified on the Task - it does not necessarily mean that the Task command line has started executing.

values.name: Completed
values.description: The Task is no longer eligible to run, usually because the Task has finished successfully, or the Task has finished unsuccessfully and has exhausted its retry limit. A Task is also marked as completed if an error occurred launching the Task, or when the Task has been terminated.

values.name: Idle
values.description: The Compute Node is not currently running a Task.

values.name: Rebooting
values.description: The Compute Node is rebooting.

values.name: Reimaging
values.description: The Compute Node is reimaging.

values.name: Running
values.description: The Compute Node is running one or more Tasks (other than a StartTask).

values.name: Unusable
values.description: The Compute Node cannot be used for Task execution due to errors.

values.name: Creating
values.description: The Batch service has obtained the underlying virtual machine from Azure Compute, but it has not yet started to join the Pool.

values.name: Starting
values.description: The Batch service is starting on the underlying virtual machine.

values.name: WaitingForStartTask
values.description: The StartTask has started running on the Compute Node, but waitForSuccess is set and the StartTask has not yet completed.

values.name: StartTaskFailed
values.description: The StartTask has failed on the Compute Node (and exhausted all retries), and waitForSuccess is set. The Compute Node is not usable for running Tasks.

values.name: Unknown
values.description: The Batch service has lost contact with the Compute Node, and does not know its true state.

values.name: LeavingPool
values.description: The Compute Node is leaving the Pool, either because the user explicitly removed it or because the Pool is resizing or autoscaling down.

values.name: Offline
values.description: The Compute Node is not currently running a Task, and scheduling of new Tasks to the Compute Node is disabled.

values.name: Preempted
values.description: The Spot/Low-priority Compute Node has been preempted. Tasks which were running on the Compute Node when it was preempted will be rescheduled when another Compute Node becomes available.

values.name: UpgradingOS
values.description: The Compute Node is undergoing an OS upgrade operation.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Tasks can be scheduled on the Compute Node.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: No new Tasks will be scheduled on the Compute Node. Tasks already running on the Compute Node may still run to completion. All Compute Nodes start with scheduling enabled.

values.name: Running
values.description: The StartTask is currently running.

values.name: Completed
values.description: The StartTask has exited with exit code 0, or the StartTask has failed and the retry limit has reached, or the StartTask process did not run due to Task preparation errors (such as resource file download failures).

values.name: Requeue
values.description: Terminate running Task processes and requeue the Tasks. The Tasks will run again when a Compute Node is available. Restart the Compute Node as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: Terminate
values.description: Terminate running Tasks. The Tasks will be completed with failureInfo indicating that they were terminated, and will not run again. Restart the Compute Node as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: TaskCompletion
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete. Schedule no new Tasks while waiting. Restart the Compute Node when all Tasks have completed.

values.name: RetainedData
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete, then wait for all Task data retention periods to expire. Schedule no new Tasks while waiting. Restart the Compute Node when all Task retention periods have expired.

values.name: Requeue
values.description: Terminate running Task processes and requeue the Tasks. The Tasks may run again on other Compute Nodes, or when Task scheduling is re-enabled on this Compute Node. Enter offline state as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: Terminate
values.description: Terminate running Tasks. The Tasks will be completed with failureInfo indicating that they were terminated, and will not run again. Enter offline state as soon as Tasks have been terminated.

values.name: TaskCompletion
values.description: Allow currently running Tasks to complete. Schedule no new Tasks while waiting. Enter offline state when all Tasks have completed.

values.description: Error

values.name: Info
values.description: Info

values.name: Warning
values.description: Warning

Models.name: BatchApplicationListResult
Models.description: The result of listing the applications available in an Account.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The list of applications available in the Account.

valueType.name: BatchApplication
valueType.description: Contains information about an application in an Azure Batch Account.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string that uniquely identifies the application within the Account.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: The display name for the application.

properties.name: versions
properties.description: The list of available versions of the application.

properties.name: odata.nextLink
properties.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

Models.name: BatchError
Models.description: An error response received from the Azure Batch service.

properties.name: code
properties.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

properties.name: message
properties.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

type.name: BatchErrorMessage
type.description: An error message received in an Azure Batch error response.

properties.name: lang
properties.description: The language code of the error message.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The text of the message.

properties.name: values
properties.description: A collection of key-value pairs containing additional details about the error.

valueType.name: BatchErrorDetail
valueType.description: An item of additional information included in an Azure Batch error response.

properties.name: key
properties.description: An identifier specifying the meaning of the Value property.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The additional information included with the error response.

Models.name: BatchPoolListUsageMetricsResult
Models.description: The result of a listing the usage metrics for an Account.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The Pool usage metrics data.

valueType.name: BatchPoolUsageMetrics
valueType.description: Usage metrics for a Pool across an aggregation interval.

properties.name: poolId
properties.description: The ID of the Pool whose metrics are aggregated in this entry.

properties.name: startTime
properties.description: The start time of the aggregation interval covered by this entry.

properties.name: endTime
properties.description: The end time of the aggregation interval covered by this entry.

properties.name: vmSize
properties.description: The size of virtual machines in the Pool. All VMs in a Pool are the same size. For information about available sizes of virtual machines in Pools, see Choose a VM size for Compute Nodes in an Azure Batch Pool (https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).

properties.name: totalCoreHours
properties.description: The total core hours used in the Pool during this aggregation interval.

properties.name: odata.nextLink
properties.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

Models.name: BatchPoolCreateContent
Models.description: Parameters for creating an Azure Batch Pool.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Pool within the Account. The ID can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters. The ID is case-preserving and case-insensitive (that is, you may not have two Pool IDs within an Account that differ only by case).

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: The display name for the Pool. The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

properties.name: vmSize
properties.description: The size of virtual machines in the Pool. All virtual machines in a Pool are the same size. For information about available VM sizes for Pools using Images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with virtualMachineConfiguration), see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/) or Sizes for Virtual Machines (Windows) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/). Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).

properties.name: virtualMachineConfiguration
properties.description: The virtual machine configuration for the Pool. This property must be specified.

type.name: VirtualMachineConfiguration
type.description:
The configuration for Compute Nodes in a Pool based on the Azure Virtual
Machines infrastructure.

properties.name: imageReference
properties.description: A reference to the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image or the custom Virtual Machine Image to use.

type.name: ImageReference
type.description:
A reference to an Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image or a Azure Compute Gallery Image.
To get the list of all Azure Marketplace Image references verified by Azure Batch, see the
' List Supported Images ' operation.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: The publisher of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image. For example, Canonical or MicrosoftWindowsServer.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: The offer type of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image. For example, UbuntuServer or WindowsServer.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: The SKU of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image. For example, 18.04-LTS or 2019-Datacenter.

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace Image. A value of 'latest' can be specified to select the latest version of an Image. If omitted, the default is 'latest'.

properties.name: virtualMachineImageId
properties.description: The ARM resource identifier of the Azure Compute Gallery Image. Compute Nodes in the Pool will be created using this Image Id. This is of the form /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/galleries/{galleryName}/images/{imageDefinitionName}/versions/{VersionId} or /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/galleries/{galleryName}/images/{imageDefinitionName} for always defaulting to the latest image version. This property is mutually exclusive with other ImageReference properties. The Azure Compute Gallery Image must have replicas in the same region and must be in the same subscription as the Azure Batch account. If the image version is not specified in the imageId, the latest version will be used. For information about the firewall settings for the Batch Compute Node agent to communicate with the Batch service see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/batch/batch-api-basics#virtual-network-vnet-and-firewall-configuration.

properties.name: exactVersion
properties.description: The specific version of the platform image or marketplace image used to create the node. This read-only field differs from 'version' only if the value specified for 'version' when the pool was created was 'latest'.

properties.name: nodeAgentSkuId
properties.description: The SKU of the Batch Compute Node agent to be provisioned on Compute Nodes in the Pool. The Batch Compute Node agent is a program that runs on each Compute Node in the Pool, and provides the command-and-control interface between the Compute Node and the Batch service. There are different implementations of the Compute Node agent, known as SKUs, for different operating systems. You must specify a Compute Node agent SKU which matches the selected Image reference. To get the list of supported Compute Node agent SKUs along with their list of verified Image references, see the 'List supported Compute Node agent SKUs' operation.

properties.name: windowsConfiguration
properties.description: Windows operating system settings on the virtual machine. This property must not be specified if the imageReference property specifies a Linux OS Image.

type.name: WindowsConfiguration
type.description: Windows operating system settings to apply to the virtual machine.

properties.name: enableAutomaticUpdates
properties.description: Whether automatic updates are enabled on the virtual machine. If omitted, the default value is true.

properties.name: dataDisks
properties.description: The configuration for data disks attached to the Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must be specified if the Compute Nodes in the Pool need to have empty data disks attached to them. This cannot be updated. Each Compute Node gets its own disk (the disk is not a file share). Existing disks cannot be attached, each attached disk is empty. When the Compute Node is removed from the Pool, the disk and all data associated with it is also deleted. The disk is not formatted after being attached, it must be formatted before use - for more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/linux/classic/attach-disk#initialize-a-new-data-disk-in-linux and https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/attach-disk-ps#add-an-empty-data-disk-to-a-virtual-machine.

valueType.name: DataDisk
valueType.description:
Settings which will be used by the data disks associated to Compute Nodes in
the Pool. When using attached data disks, you need to mount and format the
disks from within a VM to use them.

properties.name: logicalUnitNumber
properties.description: The logical unit number. The logicalUnitNumber is used to uniquely identify each data disk. If attaching multiple disks, each should have a distinct logicalUnitNumber. The value must be between 0 and 63, inclusive.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: The type of caching to be enabled for the data disks. The default value for caching is readwrite. For information about the caching options see: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazurestorage/2012/06/27/exploring-windows-azure-drives-disks-and-images/.

properties.name: diskSizeGb
properties.description: The initial disk size in gigabytes.

properties.name: storageAccountType
properties.description: The storage Account type to be used for the data disk. If omitted, the default is "standard_lrs".

properties.name: licenseType
properties.description:
This only applies to Images that contain the Windows operating system, and
should only be used when you hold valid on-premises licenses for the Compute
Nodes which will be deployed. If omitted, no on-premises licensing discount is
applied. Values are:

 Windows_Server - The on-premises license is for Windows
Server.
 Windows_Client - The on-premises license is for Windows Client.

properties.name: containerConfiguration
properties.description: The container configuration for the Pool. If specified, setup is performed on each Compute Node in the Pool to allow Tasks to run in containers. All regular Tasks and Job manager Tasks run on this Pool must specify the containerSettings property, and all other Tasks may specify it.

type.name: ContainerConfiguration
type.description: The configuration for container-enabled Pools.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The container technology to be used.

properties.name: containerImageNames
properties.description: The collection of container Image names. This is the full Image reference, as would be specified to "docker pull". An Image will be sourced from the default Docker registry unless the Image is fully qualified with an alternative registry.

properties.name: containerRegistries
properties.description: Additional private registries from which containers can be pulled. If any Images must be downloaded from a private registry which requires credentials, then those credentials must be provided here.

valueType.name: ContainerRegistryReference
valueType.description: A private container registry.

properties.name: username
properties.description: The user name to log into the registry server.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password to log into the registry server.

properties.name: registryServer
properties.description: The registry URL. If omitted, the default is "docker.io".

properties.name: identityReference
properties.description: The reference to the user assigned identity to use to access an Azure Container Registry instead of username and password.

type.name: BatchNodeIdentityReference
type.description:
The reference to a user assigned identity associated with the Batch pool which
a compute node will use.

properties.name: resourceId
properties.description: The ARM resource id of the user assigned identity.

properties.name: diskEncryptionConfiguration
properties.description: The disk encryption configuration for the pool. If specified, encryption is performed on each node in the pool during node provisioning.

type.name: DiskEncryptionConfiguration
type.description:
The disk encryption configuration applied on compute nodes in the pool.
Disk encryption configuration is not supported on Linux pool created with
Azure Compute Gallery Image.

properties.name: targets
properties.description: The list of disk targets Batch Service will encrypt on the compute node. If omitted, no disks on the compute nodes in the pool will be encrypted. On Linux pool, only "TemporaryDisk" is supported; on Windows pool, "OsDisk" and "TemporaryDisk" must be specified.

properties.name: nodePlacementConfiguration
properties.description: The node placement configuration for the pool. This configuration will specify rules on how nodes in the pool will be physically allocated.

type.name: BatchNodePlacementConfiguration
type.description:
For regional placement, nodes in the pool will be allocated in the same region.
For zonal placement, nodes in the pool will be spread across different zones
with best effort balancing.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: Node placement Policy type on Batch Pools. Allocation policy used by Batch Service to provision the nodes. If not specified, Batch will use the regional policy.

properties.name: extensions
properties.description: The virtual machine extension for the pool. If specified, the extensions mentioned in this configuration will be installed on each node.

valueType.name: VMExtension
valueType.description: The configuration for virtual machine extensions.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the virtual machine extension.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: The name of the extension handler publisher.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the extension.

properties.name: typeHandlerVersion
properties.description: The version of script handler.

properties.name: autoUpgradeMinorVersion
properties.description: Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.

properties.name: enableAutomaticUpgrade
properties.description: Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: JSON formatted public settings for the extension.

properties.name: protectedSettings
properties.description: The extension can contain either protectedSettings or protectedSettingsFromKeyVault or no protected settings at all.

properties.name: provisionAfterExtensions
properties.description: The collection of extension names. Collection of extension names after which this extension needs to be provisioned.

properties.name: osDisk
properties.description: Settings for the operating system disk of the Virtual Machine.

type.name: OSDisk
type.description: Settings for the operating system disk of the compute node (VM).

properties.name: ephemeralOSDiskSettings
properties.description: Specifies the ephemeral Disk Settings for the operating system disk used by the compute node (VM).

type.name: DiffDiskSettings
type.description:
Specifies the ephemeral Disk Settings for the operating system disk used by the
compute node (VM).

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies the ephemeral disk placement for operating system disk for all VMs in the pool. This property can be used by user in the request to choose the location e.g., cache disk space for Ephemeral OS disk provisioning. For more information on Ephemeral OS disk size requirements, please refer to Ephemeral OS disk size requirements for Windows VMs at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/ephemeral-os-disks#size-requirements and Linux VMs at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/linux/ephemeral-os-disks#size-requirements.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values are: None, ReadOnly, ReadWrite. The default values are: None for Standard storage. ReadOnly for Premium storage.

properties.name: diskSizeGB
properties.description: The initial disk size in GB when creating new OS disk.

properties.name: managedDisk
properties.description: The managed disk parameters.

type.name: ManagedDisk
type.description: The managed disk parameters.

properties.name: storageAccountType
properties.description: The storage account type for managed disk.

properties.name: writeAcceleratorEnabled
properties.description: Specifies whether writeAccelerator should be enabled or disabled on the disk.

properties.name: securityProfile
properties.description: Specifies the security profile settings for the virtual machine or virtual machine scale set.

type.name: SecurityProfile
type.description: Specifies the security profile settings for the virtual machine or virtual machine scale set.

properties.name: encryptionAtHost
properties.description: This property can be used by user in the request to enable or disable the Host Encryption for the virtual machine or virtual machine scale set. This will enable the encryption for all the disks including Resource/Temp disk at host itself.

properties.name: securityType
properties.description: Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine. It has to be set to any specified value to enable UefiSettings.

properties.name: uefiSettings
properties.description: Specifies the security settings like secure boot and vTPM used while creating the virtual machine. Specifies the security settings like secure boot and vTPM used while creating the virtual machine.

type.name: UefiSettings
type.description: Specifies the security settings like secure boot and vTPM used while creating the virtual machine.

properties.name: secureBootEnabled
properties.description: Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine.

properties.name: vTpmEnabled
properties.description: Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine.

properties.name: serviceArtifactReference
properties.description: Specifies the service artifact reference id used to set same image version for all virtual machines in the scale set when using 'latest' image version. The service artifact reference id in the form of /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/galleries/{galleryName}/serviceArtifacts/{serviceArtifactName}/vmArtifactsProfiles/{vmArtifactsProfilesName}

type.name: ServiceArtifactReference
type.description:
Specifies the service artifact reference id used to set same image version
for all virtual machines in the scale set when using 'latest' image version.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The service artifact reference id of ServiceArtifactReference. The service artifact reference id in the form of /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/galleries/{galleryName}/serviceArtifacts/{serviceArtifactName}/vmArtifactsProfiles/{vmArtifactsProfilesName}

properties.name: resizeTimeout
properties.description: The timeout for allocation of Compute Nodes to the Pool. This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when enableAutoScale is set to true. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes. If you specify a value less than 5 minutes, the Batch service returns an error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).

properties.name: resourceTags
properties.description: The user-specified tags associated with the pool. The user-defined tags to be associated with the Azure Batch Pool. When specified, these tags are propagated to the backing Azure resources associated with the pool. This property can only be specified when the Batch account was created with the poolAllocationMode property set to 'UserSubscription'.

properties.name: targetDedicatedNodes
properties.description: The desired number of dedicated Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to true. If enableAutoScale is set to false, then you must set either targetDedicatedNodes, targetLowPriorityNodes, or both.

properties.name: targetLowPriorityNodes
properties.description: The desired number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to true. If enableAutoScale is set to false, then you must set either targetDedicatedNodes, targetLowPriorityNodes, or both.

properties.name: enableAutoScale
properties.description: Whether the Pool size should automatically adjust over time. If false, at least one of targetDedicatedNodes and targetLowPriorityNodes must be specified. If true, the autoScaleFormula property is required and the Pool automatically resizes according to the formula. The default value is false.

properties.name: autoScaleFormula
properties.description: A formula for the desired number of Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to false. It is required if enableAutoScale is set to true. The formula is checked for validity before the Pool is created. If the formula is not valid, the Batch service rejects the request with detailed error information. For more information about specifying this formula, see 'Automatically scale Compute Nodes in an Azure Batch Pool' (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/).

properties.name: autoScaleEvaluationInterval
properties.description: The time interval at which to automatically adjust the Pool size according to the autoscale formula. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum and maximum value are 5 minutes and 168 hours respectively. If you specify a value less than 5 minutes or greater than 168 hours, the Batch service returns an error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).

properties.name: enableInterNodeCommunication
properties.description: Whether the Pool permits direct communication between Compute Nodes. Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the Pool due to deployment restrictions on the Compute Nodes of the Pool. This may result in the Pool not reaching its desired size. The default value is false.

properties.name: networkConfiguration
properties.description: The network configuration for the Pool.

type.name: NetworkConfiguration
type.description: The network configuration for a Pool.

properties.name: subnetId
properties.description: The ARM resource identifier of the virtual network subnet which the Compute Nodes of the Pool will join. This is of the form /subscriptions/{subscription}/resourceGroups/{group}/providers/{provider}/virtualNetworks/{network}/subnets/{subnet}. The virtual network must be in the same region and subscription as the Azure Batch Account. The specified subnet should have enough free IP addresses to accommodate the number of Compute Nodes in the Pool. If the subnet doesn't have enough free IP addresses, the Pool will partially allocate Nodes and a resize error will occur. The 'MicrosoftAzureBatch' service principal must have the 'Classic Virtual Machine Contributor' Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) role for the specified VNet. The specified subnet must allow communication from the Azure Batch service to be able to schedule Tasks on the Nodes. This can be verified by checking if the specified VNet has any associated Network Security Groups (NSG). If communication to the Nodes in the specified subnet is denied by an NSG, then the Batch service will set the state of the Compute Nodes to unusable. For Pools created with virtualMachineConfiguration only ARM virtual networks ('Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks') are supported. If the specified VNet has any associated Network Security Groups (NSG), then a few reserved system ports must be enabled for inbound communication. For Pools created with a virtual machine configuration, enable ports 29876 and 29877, as well as port 22 for Linux and port 3389 for Windows. Also enable outbound connections to Azure Storage on port 443. For more details see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/batch/batch-api-basics#virtual-network-vnet-and-firewall-configuration.

properties.name: dynamicVNetAssignmentScope
properties.description: The scope of dynamic vnet assignment.

properties.name: endpointConfiguration
properties.description: The configuration for endpoints on Compute Nodes in the Batch Pool. Pool endpoint configuration is only supported on Pools with the virtualMachineConfiguration property.

type.name: BatchPoolEndpointConfiguration
type.description: The endpoint configuration for a Pool.

properties.name: inboundNatPools
properties.description: A list of inbound NAT Pools that can be used to address specific ports on an individual Compute Node externally. The maximum number of inbound NAT Pools per Batch Pool is 5. If the maximum number of inbound NAT Pools is exceeded the request fails with HTTP status code 400. This cannot be specified if the IPAddressProvisioningType is NoPublicIPAddresses.

valueType.name: InboundNatPool
valueType.description:
A inbound NAT Pool that can be used to address specific ports on Compute Nodes
in a Batch Pool externally.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the endpoint. The name must be unique within a Batch Pool, can contain letters, numbers, underscores, periods, and hyphens. Names must start with a letter or number, must end with a letter, number, or underscore, and cannot exceed 77 characters.  If any invalid values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: The protocol of the endpoint.

properties.name: backendPort
properties.description: The port number on the Compute Node. This must be unique within a Batch Pool. Acceptable values are between 1 and 65535 except for 22, 3389, 29876 and 29877 as these are reserved. If any reserved values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: frontendPortRangeStart
properties.description: The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide inbound access to the backendPort on individual Compute Nodes. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65534 except ports from 50000 to 55000 which are reserved. All ranges within a Pool must be distinct and cannot overlap. Each range must contain at least 40 ports. If any reserved or overlapping values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: frontendPortRangeEnd
properties.description: The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide inbound access to the backendPort on individual Compute Nodes. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65534 except ports from 50000 to 55000 which are reserved by the Batch service. All ranges within a Pool must be distinct and cannot overlap. Each range must contain at least 40 ports. If any reserved or overlapping values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: networkSecurityGroupRules
properties.description: A list of network security group rules that will be applied to the endpoint. The maximum number of rules that can be specified across all the endpoints on a Batch Pool is 25. If no network security group rules are specified, a default rule will be created to allow inbound access to the specified backendPort. If the maximum number of network security group rules is exceeded the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

valueType.name: NetworkSecurityGroupRule
valueType.description: A network security group rule to apply to an inbound endpoint.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: The priority for this rule. Priorities within a Pool must be unique and are evaluated in order of priority. The lower the number the higher the priority. For example, rules could be specified with order numbers of 150, 250, and 350. The rule with the order number of 150 takes precedence over the rule that has an order of 250. Allowed priorities are 150 to 4096. If any reserved or duplicate values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: access
properties.description: The action that should be taken for a specified IP address, subnet range or tag.

properties.name: sourceAddressPrefix
properties.description: The source address prefix or tag to match for the rule. Valid values are a single IP address (i.e. 10.10.10.10), IP subnet (i.e. 192.168.1.0/24), default tag, or * (for all addresses).  If any other values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400.

properties.name: sourcePortRanges
properties.description: The source port ranges to match for the rule. Valid values are '*' (for all ports 0 - 65535), a specific port (i.e. 22), or a port range (i.e. 100-200). The ports must be in the range of 0 to 65535. Each entry in this collection must not overlap any other entry (either a range or an individual port). If any other values are provided the request fails with HTTP status code 400. The default value is '*'.

properties.name: publicIpAddressConfiguration
properties.description: The Public IPAddress configuration for Compute Nodes in the Batch Pool. Public IP configuration property is only supported on Pools with the virtualMachineConfiguration property.

type.name: PublicIpAddressConfiguration
type.description: The public IP Address configuration of the networking configuration of a Pool.

properties.name: IpAddressProvisioningType
properties.description: The provisioning type for Public IP Addresses for the Pool. The default value is BatchManaged.

properties.name: ipAddressIds
properties.description: The list of public IPs which the Batch service will use when provisioning Compute Nodes. The number of IPs specified here limits the maximum size of the Pool - 100 dedicated nodes or 100 Spot/Low-priority nodes can be allocated for each public IP. For example, a pool needing 250 dedicated VMs would need at least 3 public IPs specified. Each element of this collection is of the form: /subscriptions/{subscription}/resourceGroups/{group}/providers/Microsoft.Network/publicIPAddresses/{ip}.

properties.name: enableAcceleratedNetworking
properties.description: Whether this pool should enable accelerated networking. Accelerated networking enables single root I/O virtualization (SR-IOV) to a VM, which may lead to improved networking performance. For more details, see: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-network/accelerated-networking-overview.

properties.name: startTask
properties.description: A Task specified to run on each Compute Node as it joins the Pool. The Task runs when the Compute Node is added to the Pool or when the Compute Node is restarted.

type.name: BatchStartTask
type.description:
Batch will retry Tasks when a recovery operation is triggered on a Node.
Examples of recovery operations include (but are not limited to) when an
unhealthy Node is rebooted or a Compute Node disappeared due to host failure.
Retries due to recovery operations are independent of and are not counted
against the maxTaskRetryCount. Even if the maxTaskRetryCount is 0, an internal
retry due to a recovery operation may occur. Because of this, all Tasks should
be idempotent. This means Tasks need to tolerate being interrupted and
restarted without causing any corruption or duplicate data. The best practice
for long running Tasks is to use some form of checkpointing. In some cases the
StartTask may be re-run even though the Compute Node was not rebooted. Special
care should be taken to avoid StartTasks which create breakaway process or
install/launch services from the StartTask working directory, as this will
block Batch from being able to re-run the StartTask.

properties.name: commandLine
properties.description: The command line of the StartTask. The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux. If the command line refers to file paths, it should use a relative path (relative to the Task working directory), or use the Batch provided environment variable (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/batch/batch-compute-node-environment-variables).

properties.name: containerSettings
properties.description: The settings for the container under which the StartTask runs. When this is specified, all directories recursively below the AZ_BATCH_NODE_ROOT_DIR (the root of Azure Batch directories on the node) are mapped into the container, all Task environment variables are mapped into the container, and the Task command line is executed in the container. Files produced in the container outside of AZ_BATCH_NODE_ROOT_DIR might not be reflected to the host disk, meaning that Batch file APIs will not be able to access those files.

type.name: BatchTaskContainerSettings
type.description: The container settings for a Task.

properties.name: containerRunOptions
properties.description: Additional options to the container create command. These additional options are supplied as arguments to the "docker create" command, in addition to those controlled by the Batch Service.

properties.name: imageName
properties.description: The Image to use to create the container in which the Task will run. This is the full Image reference, as would be specified to "docker pull". If no tag is provided as part of the Image name, the tag ":latest" is used as a default.

properties.name: registry
properties.description: The private registry which contains the container Image. This setting can be omitted if was already provided at Pool creation.

properties.name: workingDirectory
properties.description: The location of the container Task working directory. The default is 'taskWorkingDirectory'.

properties.name: resourceFiles
properties.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the Compute Node before running the command line.  There is a maximum size for the list of resource files. When the max size is exceeded, the request will fail and the response error code will be RequestEntityTooLarge. If this occurs, the collection of ResourceFiles must be reduced in size. This can be achieved using .zip files, Application Packages, or Docker Containers. Files listed under this element are located in the Task's working directory.

valueType.name: ResourceFile
valueType.description: A single file or multiple files to be downloaded to a Compute Node.

properties.name: autoStorageContainerName
properties.description: The storage container name in the auto storage Account. The autoStorageContainerName, storageContainerUrl and httpUrl properties are mutually exclusive and one of them must be specified.

properties.name: storageContainerUrl
properties.description: The URL of the blob container within Azure Blob Storage. The autoStorageContainerName, storageContainerUrl and httpUrl properties are mutually exclusive and one of them must be specified. This URL must be readable and listable from compute nodes. There are three ways to get such a URL for a container in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read and list permissions on the container, use a managed identity with read and list permissions, or set the ACL for the container to allow public access.

properties.name: httpUrl
properties.description: The URL of the file to download. The autoStorageContainerName, storageContainerUrl and httpUrl properties are mutually exclusive and one of them must be specified. If the URL points to Azure Blob Storage, it must be readable from compute nodes. There are three ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob, use a managed identity with read permission, or set the ACL for the blob or its container to allow public access.

properties.name: blobPrefix
properties.description: The blob prefix to use when downloading blobs from an Azure Storage container. Only the blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix will be downloaded. The property is valid only when autoStorageContainerName or storageContainerUrl is used. This prefix can be a partial filename or a subdirectory. If a prefix is not specified, all the files in the container will be downloaded.

properties.name: filePath
properties.description: The location on the Compute Node to which to download the file(s), relative to the Task's working directory. If the httpUrl property is specified, the filePath is required and describes the path which the file will be downloaded to, including the filename. Otherwise, if the autoStorageContainerName or storageContainerUrl property is specified, filePath is optional and is the directory to download the files to. In the case where filePath is used as a directory, any directory structure already associated with the input data will be retained in full and appended to the specified filePath directory. The specified relative path cannot break out of the Task's working directory (for example by using '..').

properties.name: fileMode
properties.description: The file permission mode attribute in octal format. This property applies only to files being downloaded to Linux Compute Nodes. It will be ignored if it is specified for a resourceFile which will be downloaded to a Windows Compute Node. If this property is not specified for a Linux Compute Node, then a default value of 0770 is applied to the file.

properties.name: identityReference
properties.description: The reference to the user assigned identity to use to access Azure Blob Storage specified by storageContainerUrl or httpUrl.

properties.name: environmentSettings
properties.description: A list of environment variable settings for the StartTask.

valueType.name: EnvironmentSetting
valueType.description: An environment variable to be set on a Task process.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the environment variable.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the environment variable.

properties.name: userIdentity
properties.description: The user identity under which the StartTask runs. If omitted, the Task runs as a non-administrative user unique to the Task.

type.name: UserIdentity
type.description: The definition of the user identity under which the Task is run. Specify either the userName or autoUser property, but not both.

properties.name: username
properties.description: The name of the user identity under which the Task is run. The userName and autoUser properties are mutually exclusive; you must specify one but not both.

properties.name: autoUser
properties.description: The auto user under which the Task is run. The userName and autoUser properties are mutually exclusive; you must specify one but not both.

type.name: AutoUserSpecification
type.description: Specifies the options for the auto user that runs an Azure Batch Task.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: The scope for the auto user. The default value is pool. If the pool is running Windows, a value of Task should be specified if stricter isolation between tasks is required, such as if the task mutates the registry in a way which could impact other tasks.

properties.name: elevationLevel
properties.description: The elevation level of the auto user. The default value is nonAdmin.

properties.name: maxTaskRetryCount
properties.description: The maximum number of times the Task may be retried. The Batch service retries a Task if its exit code is nonzero. Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries. The Batch service will try the Task once, and may then retry up to this limit. For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the Task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries). If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the Task. If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the Task without limit, however this is not recommended for a start task or any task. The default value is 0 (no retries).

properties.name: waitForSuccess
properties.description: Whether the Batch service should wait for the StartTask to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any Tasks on the Compute Node. If true and the StartTask fails on a Node, the Batch service retries the StartTask up to its maximum retry count (maxTaskRetryCount). If the Task has still not completed successfully after all retries, then the Batch service marks the Node unusable, and will not schedule Tasks to it. This condition can be detected via the Compute Node state and failure info details. If false, the Batch service will not wait for the StartTask to complete. In this case, other Tasks can start executing on the Compute Node while the StartTask is still running; and even if the StartTask fails, new Tasks will continue to be scheduled on the Compute Node. The default is true.

properties.name: applicationPackageReferences
properties.description: The list of Packages to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool. When creating a pool, the package's application ID must be fully qualified (/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts/{accountName}/applications/{applicationName}). Changes to Package references affect all new Nodes joining the Pool, but do not affect Compute Nodes that are already in the Pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 Package references on any given Pool.

valueType.name: BatchApplicationPackageReference
valueType.description: A reference to an Package to be deployed to Compute Nodes.

properties.name: applicationId
properties.description: The ID of the application to deploy. When creating a pool, the package's application ID must be fully qualified (/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts/{accountName}/applications/{applicationName}).

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version of the application to deploy. If omitted, the default version is deployed. If this is omitted on a Pool, and no default version is specified for this application, the request fails with the error code InvalidApplicationPackageReferences and HTTP status code 409. If this is omitted on a Task, and no default version is specified for this application, the Task fails with a pre-processing error.

properties.name: taskSlotsPerNode
properties.description: The number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool. The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the vmSize of the pool or 256.

properties.name: taskSchedulingPolicy
properties.description: How Tasks are distributed across Compute Nodes in a Pool. If not specified, the default is spread.

type.name: BatchTaskSchedulingPolicy
type.description: Specifies how Tasks should be distributed across Compute Nodes.

properties.name: nodeFillType
properties.description: How Tasks are distributed across Compute Nodes in a Pool. If not specified, the default is spread.

properties.name: userAccounts
properties.description: The list of user Accounts to be created on each Compute Node in the Pool.

valueType.name: UserAccount
valueType.description:
Properties used to create a user used to execute Tasks on an Azure Batch
Compute Node.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the user Account. Names can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 20.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password for the user Account.

properties.name: elevationLevel
properties.description: The elevation level of the user Account. The default value is nonAdmin.

properties.name: linuxUserConfiguration
properties.description: The Linux-specific user configuration for the user Account. This property is ignored if specified on a Windows Pool. If not specified, the user is created with the default options.

type.name: LinuxUserConfiguration
type.description: Properties used to create a user Account on a Linux Compute Node.

properties.name: uid
properties.description: The user ID of the user Account. The uid and gid properties must be specified together or not at all. If not specified the underlying operating system picks the uid.

properties.name: gid
properties.description: The group ID for the user Account. The uid and gid properties must be specified together or not at all. If not specified the underlying operating system picks the gid.

properties.name: sshPrivateKey
properties.description: The SSH private key for the user Account. The private key must not be password protected. The private key is used to automatically configure asymmetric-key based authentication for SSH between Compute Nodes in a Linux Pool when the Pool's enableInterNodeCommunication property is true (it is ignored if enableInterNodeCommunication is false). It does this by placing the key pair into the user's .ssh directory. If not specified, password-less SSH is not configured between Compute Nodes (no modification of the user's .ssh directory is done).

properties.name: windowsUserConfiguration
properties.description: The Windows-specific user configuration for the user Account. This property can only be specified if the user is on a Windows Pool. If not specified and on a Windows Pool, the user is created with the default options.

type.name: WindowsUserConfiguration
type.description: Properties used to create a user Account on a Windows Compute Node.

properties.name: loginMode
properties.description: The login mode for the user. The default value for VirtualMachineConfiguration Pools is 'batch'.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the Pool as metadata. The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

valueType.name: MetadataItem
valueType.description:
The Batch service does not assign any meaning to this metadata; it is solely
for the use of user code.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the metadata item.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the metadata item.

properties.name: mountConfiguration
properties.description: Mount storage using specified file system for the entire lifetime of the pool. Mount the storage using Azure fileshare, NFS, CIFS or Blobfuse based file system.

valueType.name: MountConfiguration
valueType.description: The file system to mount on each node.

properties.name: azureBlobFileSystemConfiguration
properties.description: The Azure Storage Container to mount using blob FUSE on each node. This property is mutually exclusive with all other properties.

type.name: AzureBlobFileSystemConfiguration
type.description: Information used to connect to an Azure Storage Container using Blobfuse.

properties.name: accountName
properties.description: The Azure Storage Account name.

properties.name: containerName
properties.description: The Azure Blob Storage Container name.

properties.name: accountKey
properties.description: The Azure Storage Account key. This property is mutually exclusive with both sasKey and identity; exactly one must be specified.

properties.name: sasKey
properties.description: The Azure Storage SAS token. This property is mutually exclusive with both accountKey and identity; exactly one must be specified.

properties.name: blobfuseOptions
properties.description: Additional command line options to pass to the mount command. These are 'net use' options in Windows and 'mount' options in Linux.

properties.name: relativeMountPath
